<<<explanation>>>: The issue with the code is that the StringTokenizer class does not automatically skip over the "|" character when splitting the string. To split the string at the "|" character, you need to call the nextToken() method twice, once to get the first part of the string and then again to get the second part of the string. The code should be modified to call nextToken() twice for each iteration of the loop, like this:
```
String str = "123|apple|apple|apple|dog$";
StringTokenizer strString = new StringTokenizer(str, "|");
int i = 0;
while (strString.hasMoreElements()) {
    if (i == 0) {
        str1 = strString.nextToken();
    } else if (i == 1) {
        str2 = Integer.parseInt(strString.nextToken());
    } else if (i == 2) {
        str3 = strString.nextToken();
        break;

    i = i + 1;
}
```
